instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Full fans, slow
threads.message:
MRI shows -127 for CPU Core PECI, everything else normal and in range.

No liquid damage, came in following a power surge, powers up normally, just full fan speed and very very slow to boot/run.

Components from the PECI circuit, let me know any other readings that would be useful:

Resistance
<TRANSISTOR>Q5050</TRANSISTOR> Pin 1 - 751
<TRANSISTOR>Q5050</TRANSISTOR> Pin 2 - 326
<TRANSISTOR>Q5050</TRANSISTOR> Pin 3 - 6.5

<RESISTOR>R5051</RESISTOR> Pin 1 - 326
<RESISTOR>R5051</RESISTOR> Pin 2 - 0

<RESISTOR>R5052</RESISTOR> Pin 1 - 751
<RESISTOR>R5052</RESISTOR> Pin 2 - 0

<RESISTOR>R5054</RESISTOR> Pin 1 - 326
<RESISTOR>R5054</RESISTOR> Pin 2 - 368

Voltage
<TRANSISTOR>Q5050</TRANSISTOR> Pin 1 - 0.1 - 0.7
<TRANSISTOR>Q5050</TRANSISTOR> Pin 2 - 1.5-1.7
<TRANSISTOR>Q5050</TRANSISTOR> Pin 3 - 1.04

<RESISTOR>R5051</RESISTOR> Pin 1 - 1.5-1.7

<RESISTOR>R5052</RESISTOR> Pin 1 - 0.1-0.7

<RESISTOR>R5054</RESISTOR> Pin 1 - 1.5-1.7
<RESISTOR>R5054</RESISTOR> Pin 2 - 1.7-1.8

I'm not familiar enough with how this circuit works to know if that fluctuation in voltage is 'normal', but I'm not sure where to head next with this one.

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Full fans, slow
threads.message:
You have a problem with a thermal sensor, not PECI itself.

First, try disconnecting webcam.
Next step, try known good working trackpad flex/board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Full fans, slow
threads.message: Neither made any difference unfortunately, that same sensor is being flagged in MRI, though I guess it's possible that could be a wild goose chase...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Full fans, slow
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Full fans, slow
threads.message: Seeing identical results with the <TRANSISTOR>Q5050</TRANSISTOR> removed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Full fans, slow
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Full fans, slow
threads.message:
Try removing <RESISTOR>R5054</RESISTOR> too.

Post voltage and diode mode at SCL/SDA lines of SMC 1 SMBus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Full fans, slow
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q5050</TRANSISTOR> is still off at this stage.

Removing <RESISTOR>R5054</RESISTOR> had no affect.

<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_1_S0_SCL</SIGNAL> - 3.39 & 0.56
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_1_S0_SDA</SIGNAL> - 3.29 & 0.55

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Full fans, slow
threads.message:
Post diode mode with 3 decimals.
Usually less than 1% difference allowed.
You can compare with similar board.

I faced with same issue on 2936.
Fortunately, that board has two resistors on that bus, which can help to isolate PCH.
Is dificil to isolate it in your case, but you can try to guess cutting off the bus close to PCH, if possible.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Full fans, slow
threads.message:
Apologies, diode mode to 3 points:
SCL - 0.576
SDA - 0.574

So I'm guessing that's close enough to be OK?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Full fans, slow
threads.message:
The values look good.
Not too much to do, if no way to isolate PCH from that SMBus...
